org.qualitune.jouleunit
Interface JouleProfiler

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractJouleProfiler, AbstractProfilerNTimes, AndroidJouleProfiler, CompositeJouleProfiler, KiwiGridProfiler, LinuxProfiler, NaoProfiler
public interface JouleProfiler

Interface for JouleProfilers that can be used to create EnergyProfiles by profiling. JouleProfilers are expected to be platform (OS) specific. Thus, multiple implementations can exist.

Author:
Claas Wilke

Method Detail

calibrate

void calibrate()
Calibrates the JouleProfiler for the platform under test (used to measure the minimum refresh interval for power rate values etc.).

endProfiling

EnergyProfile endProfiling()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Ends the profiling of this JouleProfiler. If profiling has not been started before, an IllegalStateException is expected to be thrown.

Returns:
The EnergyProfile of the profiling.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown, if profiling has not been initialized (using startProfiling()).

getEstimatedBaseConsumption

long getEstimatedBaseConsumption()
Returns the estimated base noise of this JouleProfiler in mW. The base noise is the energy consumption caused by the device under profiling without executing an application.

getEstimatedProbeEffect

long getEstimatedProbeEffect()
Returns the estimated probe effect of this JouleProfiler in mW. The probe effect is the energy consumption caused by this JouleProfiler itself during profiling.

getProfilingInterval

float getProfilingInterval()
Returns how often (in Hz) this JouleProfiler will profile the energy consumption.

Returns:
How often the energy consumption will be measured (in Hz).

isCalibrated

boolean isCalibrated()
Indicates whether or not this JouleProfiler has been already calibrated.

isProfiling

boolean isProfiling()
Indicates whether or not this JouleProfiler is currently profiling.

Returns:
true if profiling is running.

logEvent

void logEvent(java.lang.String identifier)
Logs a given event for this JouleProfiler. An event consists of an identifier that must be unique within the currently profiled EnergyProfile. Events can be used to separate the EnergyProfile into multiple parts, for which individual energy consumptions can be computed. E.g., this can be used to log the begin or end of the specific method's invocation during testing.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier of the event (Must be unique within the EnergyProfile!).

profileNTimes

java.util.List<EnergyProfile> profileNTimes(java.lang.Object source,
                                            java.lang.String methodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] args,
                                            int iterations)
                                            throws ProfilingException
Invokes a given method on a given source a given timesand results in a List of EnergyProfiles containing one EnergyProfile for each iteration.

Parameters:
source - The Object used as source of the method invocation.
methodName - The name of the Method to be invoked.
args - The arguments with which the Method shall be invoked (an array of Objects).
iterations - The number of iterations (> 0).
Returns:
A List of EnergyProfiles.
Throws:
ProfilingException - Thrown if method finding or invocation or profiling itself fails.

profileNTimes

java.util.List<EnergyProfile> profileNTimes(java.lang.Object source,
                                            java.lang.String methodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] args,
                                            java.lang.String setUpMethodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] setUpArgs,
                                            java.lang.String tearDownMethodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] tearDownArgs,
                                            int iterations)
                                            throws ProfilingException
Invokes a given method on a given source a given times using and results in a List of EnergyProfiles containing one EnergyProfile for each iteration.

Parameters:
source - The Object used as source of the method invocation.
methodName - The name of the Method to be invoked.
args - The arguments with which the Method shall be invoked (an array of Objects).
setUpMethodName - The name of the Method to be invoked as setUp method before every profiling cycle (can be null).
setUpArgs - The arguments with which the setUp Method shall be invoked (an array of Objects). Can be null if setUpMethodName is null as well.
tearDownMethodName - The name of the Method to be invoked as tearDown method after every profiling cycle (can be null).
tearDownArgs - The arguments with which the tearDownMethod shall be invoked (an array of Objects). Can be null if the tearDownMethodName is null as well.
iterations - The number of iterations (> 0).
Returns:
A List of EnergyProfiles.
Throws:
ProfilingException - Thrown if method finding or invocation or profiling itself fails.

profileNTimes

java.util.List<EnergyProfile> profileNTimes(java.lang.Object source,
                                            java.lang.String methodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] args,
                                            java.lang.Object setUpSource,
                                            java.lang.String setUpMethodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] setUpArgs,
                                            java.lang.Object tearDownSource,
                                            java.lang.String tearDownMethodName,
                                            java.lang.Object[] tearDownArgs,
                                            int iterations)
                                            throws ProfilingException
Invokes a given method on a given source a given times and results in a List of EnergyProfiles containing one EnergyProfile for each iteration.

Parameters:
source - The Object used as source of the method invocation.
methodName - The name of the Method to be invoked.
args - The arguments with which the Method shall be invoked (an array of Objects).
setUpSource - The Object on which the possibly given setUp method shall be invoked. If null, the same source argument is used instead.
setUpMethodName - The name of the Method to be invoked as setUp method before every profiling cycle (can be null).
setUpArgs - The arguments with which the setUp Method shall be invoked (an array of Objects). Can be null if setUpMethodName is null as well.
tearDownSource - The Object on which the possibly given setUp method shall be invoked. If null, the same source argument is used instead.
tearDownMethodName - The name of the Method to be invoked as tearDown method after every profiling cycle (can be null).
tearDownArgs - The arguments with which the tearDownMethod shall be invoked (an array of Objects). Can be null if the tearDownMethodName is null as well.
iterations - The number of iterations (> 0).
Returns:
A List of EnergyProfiles.
Throws:
ProfilingException - Thrown if method finding or invocation or profiling itself fails.

setBaseConsumptionConsiderationEnabled

void setBaseConsumptionConsiderationEnabled(boolean enable)
Enables or disables this JouleProfiler to consider the device's base noise (or base power rate) during profiling. If enabled, the base noise will subtracted from each PowerRate profiled with this JouleProfiler.

Parameters:
enable - If true base noise consideration is enabled (default is true).

setEstimationInterval

void setEstimationInterval(int interval)
Sets the length in seconds used for each iteration in the calibration/estimation phase. E.g., to compute the probe effect.

Parameters:
interval - Length in seconds used for each iteration in the calibration/estimation phase. E.g., to compute the probe effect.

setProbeEffectConsiderationEnabled

void setProbeEffectConsiderationEnabled(boolean enable)
Enables or disables this JouleProfiler to consider its probe effect during profiling. If enabled, the probe effect will subtracted from each PowerRate profiled with this JouleProfiler.

Parameters:
enable - If true probe effect consideration is enabled (default is true).

setProfilingInterval

void setProfilingInterval(int intervall)
Configures how often (in milliseconds) this JouleProfiler will profile the energy consumption.

Parameters:
intervall - How often the energy consumption will be measured (in milliseconds).

startProfiling

void startProfiling()
Starts the profiling of this JouleProfiler.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown, if this JouleProfiler is not able to start profiling (e.g., while profiling is already running).
